Detailed Description

template<class T>
class Sylph::Iterable< T >

Implementing this interface allows your class to be iterated by an Iterator.

This interface is also required for the correct functioning of the sforeach() keyword. Each Iterator should define an Iterator and an MutableIterator type, corresponding to the actual types returned by iterator() and mutableIterator().

Member Function Documentation

template<class T>
virtual Iterator Sylph::Iterable< T >::iterator (  )  const [pure virtual]

Get an instance of the Iterator for this class.

The iterator returned is not mutable, i.e. it cannot modify the contents of the collection.

Unless mutability is really required, it is recommended to prefer this method, as it does not allow accidential modifications.

Returns:
An Iterator specific for the class being iterated over.

Implemented in Sylph::Array< T >, Sylph::Collection< T >, Sylph::Array< T * >, Sylph::Array< String >, Sylph::Array< byte >, Sylph::Array< wchar_t >, Sylph::Array< HashEntry< Key, Value > * >, Sylph::Collection< T >, Sylph::Collection< K >, Sylph::Collection< T * >, and Sylph::Collection< HashEntry< K, V * > >.

template<class T>
virtual MutableIterator Sylph::Iterable< T >::mutableIterator (  )  [pure virtual]

Get an instance of the MutableIterator for this class.

The iterator returned is mutable, i.e. it can modifiy the contents of the collection.

Returns:
An MutableIterator for the class being iterated over.

Implemented in Sylph::Array< T >, Sylph::Collection< T >, Sylph::Array< T * >, Sylph::Array< String >, Sylph::Array< byte >, Sylph::Array< wchar_t >, Sylph::Array< HashEntry< Key, Value > * >, Sylph::Collection< T >, Sylph::Collection< K >, Sylph::Collection< T * >, and Sylph::Collection< HashEntry< K, V * > >.
